remarks: A version of ~ climrec using bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 29-Jun-2017.)
statement:
climrecf.1 $e |- F/ k ph $.
climrecf.2 $e |- F/_ k G $.
climrecf.3 $e |- F/_ k H $.
climrecf.4 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
climrecf.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
climrecf.6 $e |- ( ph -> G ~~> A ) $.
climrecf.7 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= 0 ) $.
climrecf.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( G ` k ) e. ( CC \ { 0 } ) ) $.
climrecf.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( 1 / ( G ` k ) ) ) $.
climrecf.10 $e |- ( ph -> H e. W ) $.
climrecf $p |- ( ph -> H ~~> ( 1 / A ) ) $.
$d Z k $.
